alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn, western Powder River, southern Rosebud and eastern Sheridan Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Lame Deer to 10 miles east of Sheridan. Storms are moving slowly in a general northward direction. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lame Deer, Busby, Ashland, Birney, Leiter, Tongue River Reservoir, Moorhead, Birney Village, Otter, Sonnette, Kirby, Muddy Cluster and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Montana...and north central Wyoming.
